alert.note: Alert for Butler; Choctaw; Clarke; Conecuh; Covington; Crenshaw; Monroe; Washington; Wilcox (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hard Freeze Warning issued January 19 at 7:40PM CST until January 20 at 9:00AM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...HARD FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 9 AM CST SATURDAY... ...HARD FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM SATURDAY TO 9 AM CST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the first Hard Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 19 expected. For the second Hard Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 17 expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Alabama and southeast Mississippi. * WHEN...For the first Hard Freeze Warning, from midnight tonight to 9 AM CST Saturday. For the second Hard Freeze Warning, from 9 PM Saturday to 9 AM CST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
